  • 1.I.1E

    #Linear Algebra
    2008

    Let AAA be an n×nn \times nn×n matrix over C\mathbb{C}C. What does it mean to say that λ\lambdaλ is an eigenvalue of AAA ? Show that AAA has at least one eigenvalue. For each of the following statements, provide a proof or a counterexample as appropriate.

    (i) If AAA is Hermitian, all eigenvalues of AAA are real.

    (ii) If all eigenvalues of AAA are real, AAA is Hermitian.

    (iii) If all entries of AAA are real and positive, all eigenvalues of AAA have positive real part.

    (iv) If AAA and BBB have the same trace and determinant then they have the same eigenvalues.

He paints post 0 , and then chooses one of the two nearest neighbours, 1 or N−1N-1N−1, with equal probability, moving to the chosen post and painting it. After painting a post, he chooses with equal probability one of the two nearest neighbours, moves there and paints it (regardless of whether it is already painted). Find the distribution of the last post unpainted.
